result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Herrera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher J Herrera appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Christopher J Herrera.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is attempting to schedule a TAD evaluation. Parties are pursuing a DPA resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher J Herrera appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Christopher J Herrera.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. State requests to have the defendant complete a TAD evaluation. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders bail to be returned to the person who posted.

Defendant Christopher J Herrera in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/17/2022@1pm
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-17-2022 @1p
